headline: DeSantis is 'creating havoc' in Florida, Democratic candidate for governor Nikki Fried says
author: Matt Leach
sentences: "People who may have sat on the sidelines, the next generation, who understand that it is their rights that are going to be infringed uponyou are going to see women and men all across the state, all across the country, not only protesting and marching, registering to vote and showing up," she continued.

FLORIDA HOUSE PASSES BILL STRIPPING DISNEY OF SELF GOVERNING STATUS
DeSantis signed legislation last month stripping Walt Disney World of a decades-old special agreement that allowed the theme park to govern itself after a public spat with the company over new legislation regarding parents' rights.

The legislation, officially named Parental Rights in Education, bans school employees or third parties from giving classroom instruction on "sexual orientation" or "gender identity" in kindergarten through third grade.

"As the only one [Democrat] who's been able to win our state since Barack Obama, I'm confident that the Democrats are going to want a proven winner, a proven advocate and somebody that they trust," she said.

MARCO RUBIO BLASTS DEMOCRATS OVER RECORD GAS PRICES, INFLATION: THEY WANT THIS
Fried said one of her first acts in office would be to declare a state of emergency on housing.
"This governor and this radical right legislature took that time to divide our state, to marginalize communities instead of focusing on these issues," Fried said.
Fried must first defeat U.S. Rep. Charlie Crist, a former Florida governor, in the August primary before she can face DeSantis in November's general election.
Ron DeSantis is "creating havoc" in the Sunshine State, a Florida candidate for governor, Nikki Fried, told Fox News in an exclusive, wide-ranging interview.
"We have been talking about the potential reversal of Roe v. Wade for four decades at this point, and now, unfortunately, this is a reality," said Fried.
"We are excited for a new opportunity to have a new governor, a female governor, who is going to stop being an embarrassment for our state," she said.
He is creating havoc in our local communities," said Fried, a Democrat who's served as the states agriculture commissioner since her election in 2018.
"Unfortunately, he's more concerned about fighting with Disney and changing congressional maps than he actually cares about the people on the ground.
Fried told Fox News that she believed the leaked Supreme Court draft decision to overturn Roe v. Wade will have a "tremendous" impact on the race.
Fried said she welcomes new residents to Florida, but noted that the state has not planned for the mass migration of people from other states.
"This governor has one goal and one goal only: to get to the White House, not to take care of the people of our state," Fried added.
"So not only do we need to reverse it, but we need to create better protections for each of those classes of individuals."
Florida metros have recently seen a dramatic increase in rent prices, according to a Realtor.com study released Thursday.
Miami and Tampa have some of the highest inflation rates in the nation, according to a Redfin study released in May.
"The fact of the matter is, there are no exceptions for rape, for incest, for victims of sex trafficking," she said.
"We've been asking the governor to take this issue seriously," Fried told Fox News in regard to housing costs.
A Florida judge recently blocked DeSantis' redistricting map from taking effect before the midterm elections.
During a press conference earlier this month he said "well see what ends up being the result going forward."
Miami and Tampa are among some of the country's hottest destinations, according to the Redfin study.
"The fact of the matter is anything over 10% is price gouging when it comes to rent," Fried said.
"The predatory landlords that are happening out here, this is pure greed and that's got to stop."
Crist held a 19 point lead in the polls according to the latest Real Clear Politics average.
Fried also called Florida's so-called "Don't Say Gay" law a "national embarrassment."
The governor signed a bill in April prohibiting all abortions after 15 weeks.
Miami was up 51.6% from April 2021, Orlando was up 32.9% and Tampa 27.8%.
Fried said, if elected, she would work to reverse that legislation.
DeSantis called the leak "judicial insurrection."
